node.title: South Africa's President tests positive for COVID-19
node.alt: A man in a suit gestures at a lectern
node.description: After testing positive for COVID-19 and a surge in Omicron cases, South Africa's president urges people in South Africa to get vaccinated.
node.content:
["South African President Cyril Ramaphosa is receiving treatment for mild\u00a0COVID-19\u00a0symptoms after testing positive for the virus on Sunday, his office has said.", "Mr Ramaphosa\u00a0was self-isolating in Cape Town and being monitored by the South African Military Health Service.\u00a0", "The 69-year-old was\u00a0fully vaccinated with Johnson & Johnson's in February\u00a0and expected to receive his booster shot this week.\u00a0", "The statement didn't\u00a0mention whether he had been infected with the Omicron coronavirus variant.", "Last week, Mr Ramaphosa visited four West African countries.", "He and all members of his delegation were tested for COVID-19 in each\u00a0country during the trip.", "Some in the delegation tested positive in Nigeria and returned directly to South Africa.", "Throughout the rest of the trip, Mr Ramaphosa and his delegation tested negative.", "Mr Ramaphosa\u00a0tested positive the same day that he addressed a state memorial to the last leader of\u00a0South\u00a0Africa's white minority government, F.W. de Klerk, in Cape Town.", "The President\u00a0said his own infection served as a caution to all people in South Africa to be vaccinated\u00a0to reduce the chances of serious illness, hospitalisation and death,\u00a0and remain vigilant against exposure.\u00a0", "
More than 20,000 new cases a day\u00a0
", "South Africa is battling a rapid resurgence driven by the Omicron variant, health officials have said.", "In the past few days, a nationwide outbreak believed to be linked to the new Omicron variant of COVID-19 has been infecting around 20,000 people a day.\u00a0\u00a0", "More than 70 per cent\u00a0of the cases are estimated to be from Omicron, according to genetic sequencing surveys.", "After a period of low transmission of about 200 new cases per day in early November, South Africa COVID-19 cases began rising dramatically.", "On November 25, scientists in southern Africa confirmed the Omicron variant, which has more than 50 mutations.", "Since discovering the new variant, Omicron has spread around the world \u2014 despite many nations banning new arrivals coming from South Africa.", "The flight bans angered several African leaders, and Mr Ramaphosa slammed\u00a0the moves as\u00a0scientifically \"unjustified\".", "Omicron appears to be highly transmissible and has quickly become dominant in South Africa.\u00a0", "So far, most cases have been relatively mild, and the percentage of severe cases needing oxygen has been low, doctors have said.", "Wire/ABC", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
